content: t o - m i s s / i m p o r t a n t s e c t i o n s o f t h e p a t t e r n we will be working in a continuous spiral a stitch marker is recommended to form a magic_ring with blanket yarn i chain 2 and use the 2nd chain from hook as my magic ring use whichever method you would like abbreviations materials u s t e r m i n o l o g y -crochet hook appropriate for m r m a g i c r i n g yarn size and r n d r o u n d your gauge f o f a s t e n o f f -yarn of choice b l o b a c k l o o p o n l y lantern color b o b o b b l e s t i t c h x 4 light color s t s t i t c h optional c h c h a i n contrasting s l s t s l i p s t i t c h color staff color s c s i n g l e c r o c h e t -dowel in desired b p s c b a c k p o s t s i n g l e size c r o c h e t -tapestry needle i n c i n c r e a s e -scissors d e c d e c r e a s e -stitch markers * … * r e p e a t b e t w e e n -fiber fill # s t i t c h c o u n t copyright this pattern is for personal use only you may not sell copy translate or distribute any part of this pattern you may sell any items made from it my materials materials are really up to you as long as you have a crochet hook s that can give you tight stitches you can use any yarn you prefer i m not going to include what hook size i use because it is irrelevant to your project trust yourself to find the right hook size for your gauge premier basix chenille brights if you order from their website using my link i earn a small commission no pressure click here to order dowel - i use a 3/8 x17 5 here s the ones i use tips and tricks round 4 if bpscs just aren t working out for you you can work round 4 in the blo round 7 i work a decrease between the stitch we already worked in right before the pole and the next available st of the lantern to avoid gaps if you work it this way the decrease counts as the 1st st of the next bullet point round 8
